Creatures that end a fall within the cube take no damage from the fall as the wind cushions their landing. Finally all creature's within the cube have their jump distance tripled.

boon.name: Eurasia’s Blessing
entries: The blessing of Second Princess of Thrand, Eurasia Mazino, grants you the following benefits:

items: You deal and additional +1 damage to {@filter evil aligned plants|bestiary|alignment=e|type=plant}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Stalfos moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. damage. If the target is a creature it must succeed on a DC {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stalfos Longsword.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Sporefos
entries: An undead summoned by a creature exposed to the dark twisted magic of the Shdowfell can spread it's vile rot to the creatures that it slays.
A sporefos has the following additional action.

entries.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the sporefos kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

items.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the sporefos kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Stalkin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Stalkin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Pin Prick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Sporekin
entries: An undead summoned by a creature exposed to the dark twisted magic of the Shdowfell can spread it's vile rot to the creatures that it slays.
A sporekin has the following additional action.

entries.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the sporekin kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

items.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the sporekin kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Stalhound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Stalhound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

variant.name: Sporehound
entries: An undead summoned by a creature exposed to the dark twisted magic of the Shdowfell can spread it's vile rot to the creatures that it slays.
A sporehound has the following additional action.

entries.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the sporehound kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

items.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the sporehound kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

monster.name: Re-Dead
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Re-Dead to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the Re-Dead drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: Once per turn, the Re-Dead targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the Re-Dead, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the Re-Dead's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Petrifying Gaze of all Re-Deads for the next 2 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving, throw or the Re-Dead remains attached to the creature and takes {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage on each turn until the target succeeds on the saving throw or the Re-Dead is killed.

variant.name: SpoRe-Dead
entries: An undead summoned by a creature exposed to the dark twisted magic of the Shdowfell can spread it's vile rot to the creatures that it slays.
A spore-dead has the following additional action.

entries.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the spore-dead kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

items.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the spore-dead kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

monster.name: Gibdo
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gibdo can use its Dreadful Glare and then make one attack with either its rotting fist or greatsword.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with Gibdo rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The Gibdo targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the Gibdo, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the Gibdo's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all Gibdos for the next 2 hours.

variant.name: FunGibdo
entries: An undead summoned by a creature exposed to the dark twisted magic of the Shdowfell can spread it's vile rot to the creatures that it slays.
A FunGibdo has the following additional action.

A spore zombie has the following additional action.

A spore skeleton has the following additional action.

items.name: Contaminating Filth
entries: When the spore skeleton kills a creature, there is a {@chance 20|20%} chance that creature is reanimated as an undead as if summoned by the spell {@spell covenglide's animate dead|WOR}, typically a {@creature zombie|MM}.

monster.name: Boblin, The Efficient Goblin King

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: Boblin can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Boblin can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Boblin's Scepter
entries: Boblin carries an opulent emerald scepter. He can use it to cast major illusion.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Boblin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Boblin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Slacker Sense
entries: Boblin is aware of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Boblin regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If he takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Boblin dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Empathy For The King
entries: If Boblin takes psychic damage, each creature within 20 feet of him takes that damage as well.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: Boblin's' innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Boblin is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Boblin has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Boblin makes four attacks with his tentacles or two attacks with his fleshbow. Up to two tentacle attacks can be replaced by Employee Burnout. Boblin has an endless number of tentacles.

action.name: Human Resources
entries: {@i Melee Weapon Attack}: 10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}), pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Boblin, and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn. A creature cannot be frightened by this feature again for 24 hours. Boblin has unlimited tentacle whips.

action.name: Fleshbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Employee Burnout
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by a tentacle of Boblin's must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, and Boblin regains a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage taken.

action.name: Leadership (1/rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Boblin can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that he can see within 30 feet of him makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand him. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Boblin is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Managerial Will {@recharge 5}
entries: Boblin magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Corporate Slave {@recharge 6}
entries: Boblin targets all creatures of his choice he can see within 60 feet of him. The targets must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) necrotic damage and become corrupted for 1 minute. A corrupted creature's flesh twists in alien ways. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted. The corrupted creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Productivity Ray
entries: Boblin shoots three of the following rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
1. Charm Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Boblin for 1 hour, or until Boblin harms the creature.

2. Paralyzing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
5. Enervation Ray. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

6. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or Boblin moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of Boblin's next turn or until Boblin is {@condition incapacitated}. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. Boblin can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

7. Sleep Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

8. Petrification Ray. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

9. Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust. If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.
10. Death Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Boblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

bonus.name: Resume Building {@recharge 5}
entries: Boblin dissolves into a shifting mass of flesh, tentacles, eyes, claws, and mouths. Creatures of his choice he can see within 30 feet of himself must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw, taking 4d8 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This transformation lasts until the end of Boblin's next turn. While transformed, he has advantage on attack rolls, attack rolls made against him have disadvantage, and he can move through spaces at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature Boblin can see targets him with an attack, he chooses another goblinoid within 30 feet of him. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.

legendaryHeader: The goblin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The goblin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Your Talents Are Better Suited for Other Tasks
entries: Boblin targets one creature within 120 feet of him. He breaks the creature's concentration on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes 1d4 psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary.name: An Eye For Productivity
entries: Boblin uses a random eye ray.

legendary.name: Managerial Rage
entries: Boblin makes a melee attack and moves up to half his speed without invoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Aberrant Cantrip
entries: Boblin casts a cantrip or innate spell.

legendary.name: Aberrant Casting (2 actions)
entries: Boblin casts a spell of 1st level or higher.

legendary.name: Forced Retirement (3 actions)
entries: Boblin uses Corporate Slave.

action.name: Man-Catching Chain
entries: {@i Melee Weapon Attack}: 9 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}, remove {@dc 17} Athletics or Sleight of Hand). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the man-catcher can't use this attack on anything else. The man-catcher can reel in a grappled target 15 feet on its turn as a free action. Also, a grappled target is reeled in 15 feet at the start of its turn.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Furious Defense
entries: After a creature the man-catcher can see is dealt damage by a foe within 30 feet of it, the man-catcher makes a chain attack against that foe.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bullywug has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its shortsword.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two melee attacks with its pike or bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). And if the target is Small or smaller, it is pulled up to 10 feet towards the bullywug, and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. If the target is grappled and in range, the bullywug may make one bite attack against it as a bonus action. The bullywug can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two attacks with its battleaxe.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 15 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), pulled up to 15 feet towards the bullywug, and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. If the target is grappled, the bullywug may make one bite attack against it as a bonus action. The bullywug can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

action.name: Stoke Fear (2/day)
entries: Each creature of the bullywug's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Stoke Fear gain advantage on all melee attack rolls until the start of the bullywug king/queen's next turn, but attack rolls against an affected creature have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Perpetually Intoxicated
entries: The bullywug has disadvantage on nonmagical attack rolls and ability checks. In addition, when the bullywug rolls damage for a spell it can reroll up to two damage dice. It must use the new rolls.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bullywug is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The bullywug has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bully makes two attacks, one with its bite and one with its quarterstaff.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

monster.name: Baltigan Sand Spider
languages: Understands Garo but does not speak it

trait.name: Sand Stealth
entries: The sand spider gains an additional +3 to Stealth (+9 in total) in sand terrain.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The sand spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The sand spider has advantage on attack rolls against surprised targets.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sand spider makes two attacks with its impaling legs and one bite attack.

action.name: Impaling Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the sand spider scores a critical hit with this attack, it rolls damage dice three times instead of twice. If both impaling leg attacks hit the same target, the second hit deals an extra 11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage, or half as much poison damage with a successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw.

reaction.name: Trapdoor Ambush
entries: When a creature walks over a sand spider's hidden burrow, the spider can use its reaction to attack that creature with two impaling leg attacks. The creature is considered a surprised target for both attacks if they did not notice the burrow. If either attack hits and the target is a Medium or smaller creature, then the sand spider and the target engage in a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) contest. If the creature wins, it can immediately move 5 feet away from the sand spider. If the contest results in a tie, the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the sand spider wins, the creature is grappled and dragged by the sand spider 30 feet into its lair. If the creature is still grappled at the start of the sand spider's next turn, it becomes {@condition restrained} instead. The restrained creature can escape by using an action to make a successful {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check.

monster.name: Jahad, The Sword Spirit

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: Jahad can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when he is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Alert
entries: Jahad has a +5 bonus to initiative. He can't be surprised while he is conscious. Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against him as a result of being unseen by him.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Jahad can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. He takes 1d10 force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Jahad fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Stalwart
entries: Jahad has advantage on saving throws if he is aware of the hazard or the point of origin.

trait.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
entries: When Jahad is wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, he gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon (included in damage).

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
entries: Jahad can reroll a saving throw that he fails. If he does so, he must use the new roll, and he can't use this feature again until he finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: When Jahad hits a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell he casts before the end of his next turn.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: Jahad has advantage on Constitution saving throws that he makes to maintain concentration on a spell when he takes damage. He can perform somatic components of spells even when he has weapons or a shield in one or both hands. When a hostile creature’s movement provokes an opportunity attack from him, Jahad can use his reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

trait.name: Cruel Fate (6/Long Rest)
entries: When Jahad makes an attack roll or an ability check and rolls a 9 or lower on the d20, he can manipulate fate and treat the roll as a 10.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When Jahad makes a melee attack against a creature, he doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether he hit or not.

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn when Jahad hits a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, he can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of his next turn. When Jahad scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, he grievously wounds it. Until the start of his next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

trait.name: Runes (7)
entries: Jahad has the following seven runes prepared on his person: {@i Death, Dragon, Fire, Frost, King, Mountain, Storm}

trait.name: Monstrous Presence
entries: Each non-construct creature that sees Jahad for the first time (or the first time in 1 week) must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or see him as a terrible monster that must be slain at all costs. An affected creature must use all its movement (and Dash if necessary) to reach Jahad and attack him with a melee attack. An unaffected creature may use its action to end this effect on an affected creature, and an affected creature may remake the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. A creature that is immune to the Charmed or Frightened conditions is immune to this ability.

trait.name: Action Surge (2/Short Rest)
entries: On his turn, Jahad can take one additional action. He can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see when he uses Action Surge. He can teleport before or after the additional action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Jahad is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The Jahad has the following Wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jahad makes four melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Jahad
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 10}) magic slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire, lightning, poison, acid, or cold damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: Jahad enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. He is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Jahad Original: Red {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point he can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: Blue {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target he can see within 120 feet of him. A target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: Green {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad creates poisonous globs around up to 3 creatures within 30 feet of him that he can see. The targets must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: Black {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad summons ominous clouds that rain acid. Each creature in a 15-foot radius, 10-foot tall cylinder must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to remove the acid from itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: White {@recharge 6}
entries: A wave of sheer cold ripples forth from Jahad. Each creature within 30 feet of Jahad must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Action Surge (2/rest)
entries: On his turn, Jahad, The Sword Spirit can take one additional action. He can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see when he uses Action Surge. He can teleport before or after the additional action.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: On his turn, Jahad can regain hit points equal to 25 ({@damage 1d10 + 20}).

bonus.name: War Magic
entries: When Jahad uses his action to cast a spell, he can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Rune Master
entries: Jahad uses a rune he has prepared.

bonus.name: Weapon Bond (2 weapons)
entries: Once he has bonded a weapon to himself, Jahad can't be disarmed of that weapon unless he is {@condition incapacitated}. If it is on the same plane of existence, he can summon that weapon as a bonus action on his turn, causing it to teleport instantly to his hand. Jahad can summon only one weapon at a time with the bonus action.

reaction.name: Bahamut's Boon (6/Long Rest)
entries: Jahad can manifest protective wings that can shield him or others. When Jahad or another creature he can see within 5 feet of him is hit by an attack roll, he can use his reaction to manifest spectral wings from his back for a moment. He grants a bonus to the target's AC equal to his proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss.

reaction.name: Rune Reaction
entries: Jahad activates a rune in response to being hit or making a saving throw.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Jahad increases his AC by two when defending against a melee or ranged weapon attack.

legendaryHeader: Jahad can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cleave
entries: Jahad makes an attack against a creature within his reach.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Jahad casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Gem Step
entries: Jahad taps into the sword's gems and magically teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet of him.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (2 actions)
entries: Jahad casts a spell or uses an original spell that is recharged.

legendary.name: Kneel For Your King (2 actions)
entries: Jahad attempts to hit a creature with a weapon attack roll to frighten that target. The target must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of him until the end of his next turn. On a successful save, the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Giant Strike (2 actions)
entries: Jahad uses an Awakened ability of his sword, if available.

legendary.name: Behold the King's Might! (3 actions)
entries: Jahad uses an Exalted Form ability of his sword, if available.

trait.name: Fearless Assassin
entries: Dennis has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and can't be put to sleep with magic.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: Dennis gains a {@b +4} bonus to damage rolls with weapon attacks against, and has advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information about and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track humanoids and celestials. Dennis also has advantage on saving throws against the spells and abilities of celestials.

items: Dennis ignores difficult terrain.
Dennis has advantage on initiative rolls.
During the first round of combat Dennis has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that have yet to act.

trait.name: Can't Run
entries: Dennis can spending 1 uninterrupted minute concentrating tosense whether any celestials are humanoids are within 5 miles. They learn:

items: which of his favored enemies are present
their numbers
the creatures' general direction and distance (in miles).

entries: Dennis learns this for each groups within range.

trait.name: Did You Miss Me?
entries: When Dennis attempts to hide on they can opt to not move on that turn to incur a -10 penalty to their Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks until the start of his next turn. This penalty is lost if Dennis moves or falls {@condition prone}, and Dennis is still automatically detected if any effect or action causes them to no longer be hidden. This effect continues as long as Dennis remains motionless.

trait.name: Finally Got You Right Where I Want You
entries: Dennis has a +3 bonus to initiative. For the first turn of each combat Dennis's walking speed increases by 10ft, they can make an additional weapon attack and that attack does an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Tug Thug Dealer
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, Dennis gains the following benefits:

items: Dennis is proficient with improvised weapons.
When Dennis hits a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon, they can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dennis is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The Dennis has the following Ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dennis makes either two melee or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Name's Dennis
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bubble Blowing Baby Popper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Big Boot
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Once knocked prone, Dennis stomps on them with his big spiked boots dealing 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bubble's Death Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 200/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Can't Hide
entries: Dennis can communicate simple ideas to a beast through sounds and gestures and read its basic mood and intent like:

items: Its emotional state
Whether it is affected by magic of any sort
Its short-term needs (such as food or safety)
Any way to persuade it to not attack

entries: This cannot be used against a creature they have attacked within the past 10 minutes.

bonus.name: Cleats
entries: The Dennis can take the Dash action.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Mr. Irwinius has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: Stevinius gains a {@b +2} bonus to damage rolls with weapon attacks against, and has advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information about and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track beasts and lizardfolk.

items: Stevinius ignores difficult terrain.
Stevinius has advantage on initiative rolls.
During the first round of combat Stevinius has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that have yet to act.

trait.name: Coordinated Attack
entries: When Mr. Irwinius uses the Attack action on your turn, if their companion can see them, it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Open Hand Technique
entries: Whenever Stevinius hits a creature with an attack from {@i {@b Flurry of Blows}}, they can impose one of the following effects:

items: The target must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. or be pushed up to 15 feet away from Mr. Irwinius.
It can't take reactions until the end of Stevinius's next turn.

trait.name: Ki (5/Short Rest)
entries: Mr. Irwinius can spend these points to fuel various ki features. You start knowing three such features:

items.name: {@b Flurry of Blows}
items.entry: Immediately after using Multiattack, Stevinius can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

items.name: {@b Patient Defense}
items.entry: Stevinius can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

items.name: {@b Step of the Wind}
items.entry: Stevinius can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action, and their jump distance is doubled for the turn.

trait.name: Stunning Strike
entries: When Mr. Irwinius hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, they can spend 1 {@b {@i ki}} point and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of Stevinius's next turn.

trait.name: Grapple Savant
entries: In reference to grappling, Stevinius gains the following benefits:

items: Stevinius has advantage on attack rolls against a creature they are grappling.

Mr. Irwinius can use their action to try to pin a creature they've {@condition grappled} by making another grapple check. If Stevinius succeeds, him and the target are both {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends.

When they successfully start a grapple, Stevinius deals and additional 2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage to the target, and deals this damage whenever they hit it with a melee attack, until the grapple ends.

trait.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, Stevinius gains the following benefits:

items: Stevinius is proficient with improvised weapons.
When Stevinius hits a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon, they can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

trait.name: Animal Companion
entries: Stevinius has bonded with a stingray names {@i Stingy} who gains all the following benefits:

items: The animal companion loses its {@b {@i Multiattack}} action, if it has one.
The companion rolls for initiative, but obeys Stevinius's commands.
When using your {@b {@i Natural Explorer}} feature, you and your animal companion can both move stealthily at a normal pace.
The animal companion's proficiency bonus becomes {@b +4} and adds that to its AC and to its damage rolls.
The animal companion gains proficiency in two skills of your choice as well as all saving throws.
The animal companion gains {@b 2} additional hit die.
The animal companion gains the benefits of the {@b {@i Favored Enemy}} feature.

entries: If {@i Stingy} is ever slain, Stevinius can spend 8 hours of work and the expenditure of 25 gp worth of rare herbs and fine food to create a new body for it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mr. Irwinius is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The Stevinius has the following Ranger spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Stevinius makes two attacks.

action.name: Wombat Wack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grizzly Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Monk Arts
entries: When Stevinius makes a {@i {@b wombat wack}} or {@i {@b headbutt}} attack, they can make one unarmed strike.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: When hit by a ranged weapon attack, Stevinius can reduce the damage by 13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}). If the damage is reduced to 0, Mr. Irwinius can pend 1 {@i {@b ki}} point to make a ranged attack (range 20/60 feet) with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction.

reaction.name: Slow Fall
entries: When Stevinius takes fall damage, they can reduce the damage taken by {@b 25}.

monster.name: Mycelius - Fiendish Contagious Fungus

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Mycelius has advantage against charm or frighten effects and can't be magically put to sleep.

trait.name: Fungal Body
entries: Mycelius can't be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}, and any critical hit against him counts as a normal hit instead, unless he is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Super Symbiotic Entity
entries: Mycelius is always considered to be under the effects of {@i {@b Symbiotic Entity}}, gaining the following benefits:

items: When he deals {@i {@b Halo of Spores}} damage, he rolls the damage die a second time and adds it to the total.
His melee weapon attacks deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage to any target they hit (in attack).
He recovers 10 hit points at the start of his turn while he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Mycelius fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mycelius's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mycelius makes two Fungal Stalk attacks.

action.name: Fungal Stalk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) magic bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Fungal Fate
entries: Mycelius causes putrid spores to engulf one creature he can see within 120 feet of himself. The target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid killed by this magic rises as a myconid adult at the start of Mycelius' next turn and acts immediately after him in the initiative order. The myconid adult is under Mycelius' control.

action.name: Euphoria Spores (2/day)
entries: Mycelius releases a cloud of spores in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Other creatures in that area must each succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect early on itself on a success. When the effect ends on it, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Infestation Spores (1/day)
entries: Mycelius releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on him, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is afflicted with a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the {@i Madness of Zuggtmoy} table) that lasts until the creature is cured. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success.

bonus.name: Sinister Spreading Spores
entries: Mycelius can hurl spores up to 60 feet away, where they swirl in a 20-foot cube for 1 minute. The spores disappear early if he uses this feature again.

Whenever a creature moves into the cube or starts its turn there, that creature must mace a {@dc 18} Constitution Saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage. A creature can only take this damage once per turn.

reaction.name: Halo of Spores (2/round)
entries: When a creature moves into a space within 10 feet of Mycelius or starts its turn there, he can force that creature must mace a {@dc 18} Constitution Saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Fungal Infestation
entries: If a beast or humanoid that is Small, Medium, or Large dies within 30 feet of Mycelius, he can animate it, causing it to stand up immediately with 5 hit points. The creature uses the {@creature Myconid Adult|MM} statistics. It remains animate for 1 hour, after which time it collapses and dies. In combat, the myconid adult's turn is immediately after Mycelius's. It obeys Mycelius's mental commands.

legendaryHeader: The druid can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The druid regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Heeheehee! (1 action)
entries: Mycelius makes a {@i {@b Fungal Stalk}} attack.

legendary.name: Moldy Malaise (2 actions)
entries: Mycelius makes a {@i {@b Fungal Fate}} attack.

legendary.name: Spore Spells (2 actions)
entries: Mycelius uses an available spell.

legendary.name: Fungal Contagion Cloud (3 actions)
entries: Mycelius spews forth a massive abundance of fungal spores from his stalks that spread in a 40-foot radius around himself. Those caught in the spores must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be put under the effects of the {@spell contagion} spell.

monster.name: Myconid Mage
languages: Sylvan but does not speak it

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the Myconid Mage takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the Myconid Mage has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The Mage dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Arcane Ward (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the Myconid Mage casts an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, it can simultaneously create a magical ward on itself that. The ward has a hit point maximum equal to +16. Whenever the Mage takes damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If the ward is reduced to 0 hit points, the abjurer takes any remaining damage. When the abjurer casts an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Myconid Mage is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 11 ({@damage 3d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: The Myconid Mage ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The poisoned target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: The Myconid Mage ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the Myconid Mage. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Animating Spores (3/day)
entries: The Myconid Mage targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

reaction.name: Projected Ward
entries: When a creature the Mage can see within 30 feet takes damage, it can its {@i {@b Arcane Ward}} to absorb that damage. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the warded creature takes any remaining damage.

monster.name: Myconid Martial
languages: Understands Sylvan but does not speak it

trait.name: Samurai's Pride
entries: When the Myconid Martial wields a katana and no other weapons, is gains a {@b +2} bonus to damage rolls with that katana.

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the Myconid Martial takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the Myconid Martial has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The Marital dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: On its turn, the Myconid Martial can take one additional action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Myconid Martial uses either its Hallucination Spores or its Pacifying Spores, then makes a melee weapon attack. Alternatively, it may make two weapon attacks.

action.name: Mycelium Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 3d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: The Myconid Martial ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The poisoned target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: The Myconid Martial ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the Myconid Martial. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Animating Spores (3/day)
entries: The Myconid Martial targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Marital can to regain 11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) HP.

bonus.name: Fighting Spirit (3/Long Rest)
entries: The Myconid Martial can give itself advantage on weapon attack rolls until the end of the current turn. The Marital also gain {@b 5} temporary hit points.

monster.name: Myconid Medic
languages: Sylvan but does not speak it

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the Myconid Medic takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the Myconid Medic has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The Medic dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The myconid medic is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 11 ({@damage 3d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: The Myconid Medic ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The poisoned target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: The Myconid Medic ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Animating Spores (3/day)
entries: The Myconid Medic targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

action.name: Channel Divinity (2/Short Rest)
entries: The Medic uses their Channel Divinity in one of the following ways.

items.name: {@b Charm Animals and Plants}
items.entry: Each beast or plant creature within 30 feet that can see the Medic must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Medic for 1 minute or until it takes damage. While it is charmed by the Myconid Medic, the beast is friendly to it and other creatures it designates.

items.name: {@b Turn Undead}
items.entry: Each undead within 30 feet of the Medic must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature spends its turns moving as far away from the Medic as it can, can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the Medic, take reactions, and only take the dash action, escape from an effect that prevents it from moving, or take the Dodge action if there's nowhere to move. When an undead of CR {@b 1/2} or lower fails its saving throw, the creature is instantly destroyed.

reaction.name: Dampen Elements
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the [MONs] takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, the Medic can grant resistance to the creature against that instance of the damage.

monster.name: Myconid Monk
languages: Sylvan but does not speak it

trait.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the Myconid Monk takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Touch of Death
entries: When Myconid Monk reduces a creature within 5 feet of it to 0 hit points, it gains +9 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Stunning Strike
entries: When Myconid Monk hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, they can spend 1 {@b {@i ki}} point and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of Monk's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Myconid Monk uses either its Hallucination Spores or its Pacifying Spores, then makes a melee weapon attack.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: The Myconid Monk ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The poisoned target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: The Myconid Monk ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Rapport Spores
entries: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the Myconid Monk. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Animating Spores (3/day)
entries: The Myconid Monk targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

bonus.name: Martial Arts
entries: When the Myconid Monk uses the attack action, it can make one unarmed strike.

bonus.name: Ki (6/Short Rest)
entries: The Myconid Monk can spend these points to fuel the following ki features:

items.name: {@b Flurry of Blows}
items.entry: Immediately after using Multiattack, the Monk can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes.

items.name: {@b Patient Defense}
items.entry: The Monk can spend 1 ki point to take the Dodge action.

items.name: {@b Step of the Wind}
items.entry: The Monk can spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action, and its jump distance is doubled for the turn.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: When hit by a ranged weapon attack, the Myconid Monk can reduce the damage by 15 ({@damage 1d10 + 10}). If the damage is reduced to 0, the Monk can spend 1 {@i {@b ki}} point to make a ranged attack (range 20/60 feet) with the weapon or piece of ammunition they just caught, as part of the same reaction.

reaction.name: Slow Fall
entries: When the [MONs] takes fall damage, they can reduce the damage taken by {@b 30}.

trait.name: Green Strider
entries: The vine lord ignores movement restrictions and damage caused by natural undergrowth.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vine lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vine lord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and is within its home forest or jungle.

trait.name: Root Mind
entries: Within its home forest or jungle, the vine lord's blindsight extends to 60 ft., it succeeds on all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and it can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vine lord makes two claw attacks and four tendril attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spore Sacs (1/week)
entries: The vine lord can release seeds from specialized sacs on its tendrils. These seeds sprout into 1d4 green spore pods that reach maturity in 3 days. The pods contain noxious spores that are released when the pod is stepped on, picked, or otherwise tampered with. A humanoid or beast that inhales these spores must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or tendrils start growing inside the creature's body. If the disease is not cured within 3 months, the tendrils take over the creature's nervous system and the victim becomes a tendril puppet.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Awaken the Green (1/Day)
entries: The vine lord magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the vine lord. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the vine lord dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the vine lord takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

trait.name: Poor Vision
entries: Tendril puppets see almost nothing beyond 30 feet away.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The tendril puppet regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and is in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Root Mind
entries: Within a vine lord's forest or jungle, the tendril puppet's blindsight extends to 60 feet, it succeeds on all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and it can't be surprised.

trait.name: Green Strider
entries: The tendril puppet ignores movement restrictions and damage caused by natural undergrowth.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tendril puppet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Assegai
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Hurl Thorns
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the thorn explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. Every creature in the affected area other than the original target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When Bolg reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
You can speak, read, and write Dwarvish.

You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself. If you already have advantage against the charmed condition, you are now immune to the charmed condition.

When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn. If you already have this feature, the extra damage is double your proficiency bonus.

In response to taking damage, you may turn {@condition invisible} and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You remain invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, cast a spell, or drop Bolg.

item.name: Bolg (Dormant)
entries: This unassuming shortsword, bound with meager leather and inscribed with the name “Boblin” in Goblin script, was forged by a mythical goblin smith who made deals with the Raven Queen using perverse rituals for knowledge. As a result, he crafted Bolg, a paragon of goblin works, which inadvertently kicked off the long line of Boblin rulers, with him as the first.

items: Bolg is a sentient chaotic neutral weapon with an Intelligence of 16, a Wisdom of 18, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Goblin, and Dwarvish

entries.name: Personality
entries: Bolg is a tricky blade, using deceptive language to push its wielder into committing mischevious – but seldom truly harmful – deeds. It does, though, take great efforts into preserving the life of its wielder. It dislikes those who it deems to be spoilsports.

If someone attempts to use Bolg against its will, it can become ten times heavier than normal and can magically adhere to any Medium or larger object or surface it comes into contact with. Once it does so, it can't be wielded. Nothing short of a wish spell can separate it from the item or surface to which it is adhered without destroying one or the other, though it can choose to end the effect at any time.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The magic shortsword grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Goblin.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
You gain Darkvision of 60 feet. If you already had Darkvision, add this 60 feet to your existing total.

You may take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of your turns. If you already have this feature, you may take both the Disengage and Hide actions as part of the same bonus action.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When Drakmata reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
You can speak, read, and write Giant.
You gain +1 to your AC while wielding Drakmata.
Your bonus damage to dragon type creatures increases to {@dice 3d6}. Your bonus damage to half-dragons, dragonborn, and lizardfolk increases to {@dice 2d4}.
You can focus your senses as an action to magically discern the distance direction to the closest dragon within 30 miles of you. This special action can't be used again until the next dawn.
You have resistance to damage types that are determined by the kind of dragon that dealt you the damage (see table).

item.name: Drakmata (Dormant)
entries: This jeweled longsword was forged by the smiths of old with help of the Raven Queen for use against all dragon-kind in a long-forgotten war. Its pommel and guard are bejeweled by a ruby, sapphire, emerald, onyx, and diamond, and its blade is made of a complex alloy of gold, silver, copper, bronze, and brass.

items: Drakmata is a sentient neutral evil weapon with an Intelligence of 16, a Wisdom of 16, and a Charisma of 18. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, and Giant.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Drakmata has a deep-seated desire to slay dragons, instilled into it by its forgers of old, and it desires to be wielded by a person willing to dedicate everything toward the eradication of dragons and similar creatures. The weapon is impatient and is willing to accept most wielders, attempting to shape them into its ideal master.

If someone attempts to use Drakmata against its will, it can become ten times heavier than normal and can magically adhere to any Medium or larger object or surface it comes into contact with. Once it does so, it can't be wielded. Nothing short of a wish spell can separate it from the item or surface to which it is adhered without destroying one or the other, though it can choose to end the effect at any time.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The magic longsword grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Draconic.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a {@filter dragon|bestiary|type=dragon} with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra {@dice 2d6} damage. For this weapon, 'dragon' refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns. Additionally, half-dragons, dragonborn, and lizardfolk take an extra {@dice 1d4} damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against the Frightful Presence and breath weapons of dragons.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When Jahad reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: Jahad's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.

You learn the {@spell comprehend|PHB} languages spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have.
You can speak, read, and write Draconic and Giant.
Your Chromatic Affinity Damage increases to {@dice 2d4}. You may also use Chromatic Affinity and Elemental Shroud a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).
The number of runes you know increases to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Giant’s Oath
entries: Jahad contains primeval magic, an echo of the might of giants. After each long rest, you may choose to activate a specific rune etched on Jahad’s blade, which provides benefits according to the table below. Once per turn, when you hit a target with Jahad, you can imbue the attack with an additional effect depending on the rune you chose. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. The saving throw DC for these effects equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Constitution modifier.

rows: The target takes an extra {@dice 2d4} thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or you become {@condition invisible} to it until the start of your next turn or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.
The target takes an extra {@dice 2d10} fire damage.
The target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.
The target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of Jahad’s weapon damage type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet from you in a straight line.

The target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Jahad (Dormant)
entries: Adorned with precious gems and embossed with ancient runes, this longsword was forged by Jahad Zahard, a former lord of Baltigo, using dragon fire and techniques from the elder days of the giants. As he aged, Jahad chose to seal the kinglier aspects of his soul into this, his magnum opus, so that future lords could benefit from his wisdom and so that the order of Dragon Knights could continue to perform the dragon blood ritual he designed, which requires his magic as a component. Slumbering alone in the depths of the Dragon Knight’s fortress Castle Jahad, it grows restless... Its pommel and guard are made of a complex alloy of gold, silver, copper, bronze, and brass, bejeweled by a ruby, sapphire, emerald, onyx, and diamond. The blade is embossed with ancient runes of the giant folk that Jahad had learned in his younger days of adventure. In its exalted state, its runes increase in complexity, and amethyst, quartz, moonstone, and topaz gems appear encrusted on its surface.

items: Jahad is a sentient lawful neutral weapon with an Intelligence of 20, a Wisdom of 16, and a Charisma of 18. It has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, Giant, Orc, Elvish, Dwarvish, and Sylvan.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Jahad is the amalgamation of Jahad Zahard’s most kingly, proud, regal, and intimidating traits, with much of the knowledge that Jahad Zahard boasted in life, though its knowledge and memory are limited to what he knew at the time of making the blade sentient. Jahad desires to offer council and aid to a true lord of Baltigo, helping the nation prosper and defend itself in any way it can. The longsword is proud and fickle towards potential wielders, heavily favoring officials of Baltigo, powerful warriors, and knowledgeable scholars and spellcasters.

If someone attempts to use Jahad against its will, it can become ten times heavier than normal and can magically adhere to any Medium or larger object or surface it comes into contact with. Once it does so, it can't be wielded. Nothing short of a wish spell can separate it from the item or surface to which it is adhered without destroying one or the other, though it can choose to end the effect at any time.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: Jahad grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Orc, Dwarvish, Elvish, and Sylvan.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

items.name: Chromatic Affinity
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch one of the gems adorning Jahad. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the corresponding damage type to the gem you touched when it hits (ruby – fire, sapphire – lightning, emerald – poison, onyx – acid, diamond – cold). After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Element Shroud
entries: When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage. After using this reaction, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Rune Magic
entries: You know a number of runes equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down), chosen from the Rune Spells table. You may change the rune you know after each long rest. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can inscribe each rune you know onto one nonmagical weapon, armor, piece of clothing, or other object you touch. You temporarily learn the 1st-level spells that correspond to the runes you inscribed, as specified on the Rune Spells table, and you know those spells until you finish a long rest, when the runes fade. While you are wearing or carrying any rune-marked object, you can cast the spells associated with those runes using any spell slots you have. You can also invoke a rune inscribed on an object you are wearing or carrying and cast its associated spell without expending a spell slot or using material components. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these runes is the same as your spellcasting ability.

item.name: Pinkie of the Celestial
entries: When {@creature Mycelius - Fiendish Contagious Fungus|WOR|Mycelius} was defeated two objects appeared. A {@item Demon Core|WOR} and a severed pinkie that radiated a celestial essence
